about: A vibrant and hearty taco salad loaded with oven-roasted vegetables, crispy tortilla chips, and a zesty lime dressing. A colorful meat-free meal that is both satisfying and nutritious.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss bell pepper, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes with olive oil, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking tray and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly charred.
While vegetables roast, warm the black beans in a small pan over medium heat for 5 minutes.
Arrange chopped romaine lettuce in a large salad bowl as the base.
Top the lettuce with roasted vegetables, black beans, corn, and avocado slices.
Scatter crushed tortilla chips over the top for crunch.
Drizzle with lime juice and your favourite dressing. Toss lightly and serve immediately.

about: A wholesome and protein-packed grilled chicken bowl served over fluffy rice with fresh vegetables and a savory sauce. Perfect for a balanced and filling meal any day of the week.
instructions: Cook jasmine rice according to package instructions and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, ginger powder, salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Rest the chicken for 5 minutes then slice into strips.
Blanch broccoli and carrots in boiling water for 3 minutes, then drain.
Mix soy sauce and sesame oil together to make the sauce.
Assemble bowls with rice as the base, topped with chicken, broccoli, and carrots.
Drizzle sauce over the bowl and garnish with sesame seeds and spring onions.

about: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, Parmesan cheese, crispy pancetta, and black pepper. Simple yet deeply satisfying, it comes together in minutes with just a handful of quality ingredients.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente according to package directions.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, whole egg, and grated Parmesan. Season generously with black pepper.
Cook pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Remove skillet from heat and add hot drained pasta to the pancetta.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing quickly to coat.
Add pasta water a little at a time, tossing continuously until the sauce is creamy and silky.
Serve immediately topped with extra Parmesan and freshly cracked black pepper.

about: A juicy and flavourful classic beef burger with all the essential toppings. Made from scratch with seasoned ground beef patties, fresh vegetables, and toasted brioche buns for the ultimate burger experience.
instructions: Divide ground beef into two equal portions and shape into patties slightly wider than the buns. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat a cast iron skillet or grill pan over high heat until very hot.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side for medium doneness. Place cheese on top in the last minute of cooking.
Toast the brioche buns with butter in the same pan until golden, about 1-2 minutes.
Mix mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard together to make the burger sauce.
Spread sauce on both bun halves.
Layer lettuce, tomato, and red onion on the bottom bun.
Place the cheesy patty on top, add pickles, and close with the top bun. Serve immediately.

about: A trendy and delicious avocado toast that is creamy, crunchy, and ready in minutes. Topped with fresh avocado, a perfectly cooked egg, and a sprinkle of chili flakes for a simple yet satisfying meal.
instructions: Toast the sourdough bread slices until golden and crisp.
Halve the avocado, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper until your desired consistency.
Poach or fry eggs to your liking — soft poached eggs work best.
Spread the mashed avocado generously over each toast slice.
Top each toast with an egg, a pinch of chili flakes, and fresh microgreens.
Finish with a drizzle of olive oil and serve immediately.

about: A bold and aromatic Thai soup bursting with the flavours of lemongrass, kaffir lime, galangal, and fresh chili. Tom Yum is tangy, spicy, and deeply comforting — a true staple of Thai cuisine.
instructions: Bring broth to a boil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. Simmer for 5 minutes to infuse the broth.
Add Thai chilies and mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Season the soup with fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Adjust to taste — it should be sour, salty, and spicy.
Remove lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves before serving.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh coriander and spring onions. Serve hot.

about: A quick and satisfying fried rice dish packed with tender chicken, vegetables, and fluffy egg. Best made with day-old rice for that perfect wok-fried texture and smoky flavour.
ingredients: Spring onions and sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat until smoking.
Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add diced chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Push chicken to the side and pour beaten eggs into the centre. Scramble until just set.
Add mixed vegetables and stir everything together for 2 minutes.
Add the cold rice, breaking up any clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Season with soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper. Toss well.
Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

about: Indulgent and fluffy chocolate pancakes perfect for a weekend breakfast treat. Rich with cocoa flavour and topped with fresh berries and maple syrup for an irresistible morning stack.
ingredients: Fresh berries and maple syrup to serve
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix — lumps are fine.
Let the batter rest for 5 minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until cooked through.
Stack and serve with fresh berries and maple syrup.

about: A timeless Caesar salad with crisp romaine lettuce, crunchy homemade croutons, shaved Parmesan, and a rich creamy Caesar dressing. Simple, classic, and always a crowd pleaser.
instructions: Wash and dry romaine lettuce thoroughly. Chop into bite-sized pieces.
Make croutons by toasting cubed bread with olive oil and garlic in the oven at 180°C for 10-12 minutes until golden.
Whisk together Caesar dressing, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard in a large bowl.
Add the romaine lettuce to the bowl and toss well to coat every leaf with dressing.
Add croutons and half the Parmesan and toss again.
Transfer to a serving plate and top with remaining Parmesan shavings.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

about: Perfectly grilled salmon fillets with a crispy skin and tender flaky flesh. Seasoned simply with lemon and herbs to let the natural flavour of the salmon shine through.
ingredients: 1 tsp dried dill or fresh dill
instructions: Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels. This ensures a crispy skin.
Mix olive oil, garlic, lemon zest, dill, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Rub the marinade all over the salmon fillets and let marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat a non-stick or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Place salmon skin-side down and cook for 4-5 minutes without moving.
Flip carefully and cook for another 2-3 minutes until cooked to your liking.
Squeeze lemon juice over the fillets and garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve with lemon wedges and your choice of sides.

about: A creamy and refreshing Indian yogurt-based drink blended with ripe mango pulp. Mango Lassi is sweet, tangy, and incredibly cooling — perfect for hot days or alongside spicy food.
ingredients: 1 cup ripe mango pulp or 2 fresh mangoes
instructions: Peel and chop fresh mangoes if using whole fruit. Blend into a smooth pulp.
Add yogurt, cold milk, sugar, and cardamom to the blender with the mango pulp.
Blend everything together until smooth and frothy, about 1-2 minutes.
Taste and adjust sweetness as needed.
Fill glasses with ice cubes.
Pour the mango lassi over the ice.
Garnish with a pinch of saffron and chopped pistachios. Serve immediately.

about: A bright and refreshing homemade strawberry lemonade made with fresh strawberries and real lemon juice. Naturally sweet and perfectly tart, it is the ultimate summer drink.
ingredients: Fresh mint and lemon slices for garnish
instructions: Make simple syrup by combining sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan. Heat until sugar dissolves, then cool.
Blend strawberries until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh sieve to remove seeds.
In a large pitcher, combine strawberry puree, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Add 3 cups of cold water and stir well to combine.
Taste and adjust sweetness or tartness as preferred.
Fill glasses with ice cubes and pour in the strawberry lemonade.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and lemon slices. Serve immediately.

about: A fresh and colourful Greek salad tossed with crisp vegetables, briny Kalamata olives, and creamy feta cheese, all dressed in a simple olive oil and herb dressing. Light, healthy, and full of Mediterranean flavour.
instructions: Chop tomatoes into wedges and slice cucumber into half-moons.
Chop green bell pepper into bite-sized chunks and thinly slice red onion.
Combine all vegetables in a large salad bowl.
Add Kalamata olives and feta cheese cubes on top.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle dried oregano, salt, and black pepper over the salad.
Toss gently to combine without breaking the feta too much. Serve fresh.

about: A rich and velvety mushroom soup made with a medley of fresh mushrooms, cream, and aromatic herbs. This comforting soup is deeply savoury with a smooth, luxurious texture that warms you from the inside out.
ingredients: Fresh parsley and crusty bread to serve
instructions: Clean and slice mushrooms. Dice onion and mince garlic.
Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and thyme, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add mushrooms and cook for 8-10 minutes until they release their liquid and turn golden.
Sprinkle flour over the mushrooms and stir for 1 minute to cook out the raw flour taste.
Pour in broth gradually, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Bring to a simmer.
Use an immersion blender to partially blend the soup for a creamy yet chunky texture.
Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Ladle into bowls, garnish with parsley, and serve with crusty bread.

about: A rich and intensely flavoured Indonesian dry curry made with beef slow-cooked in a spiced coconut milk sauce until tender and caramelised. Beef Rendang is a celebratory dish known for its complex and aromatic taste.
ingredients: 1kg beef chuck, cut into large cubes
Spice paste: 8 shallots, 5 cloves garlic, 4 red chilies, 2cm galangal, 2cm ginger, 1 tsp turmeric
instructions: Blend all spice paste ingredients together into a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Fry the spice paste for 5-7 minutes until fragrant and oil separates.
Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and turmeric leaves. Stir for 2 minutes.
Add beef cubes and coat well with the spice paste. Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a boil, stirring frequently.
Add tamarind paste and sugar. Reduce heat to low.
Simmer uncovered for 1.5 to 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the liquid reduces and the beef is very tender.
Continue cooking until the coconut milk is almost completely absorbed and the meat is dark and caramelised.
Adjust salt and serve with steamed rice.

about: Crispy golden fries tossed in fragrant garlic butter and fresh herbs. These Garlic Butter Fries are the ultimate comfort side dish — irresistibly crunchy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.
instructions: Cut potatoes into even fries and soak in cold water for 30 minutes to remove excess starch.
Drain and pat completely dry with paper towels.
Preheat oven to 220°C. Toss fries with vegetable oil, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread in a single layer on a baking tray. Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and crispy.
While fries bake, melt butter in a small pan over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant but not browned.
Remove fries from oven and immediately toss with garlic butter and fresh parsley.
Top with Parmesan if desired and serve hot.

about: A classic Italian no-bake dessert made with layers of espresso-soaked ladyfingers and a rich mascarpone cream, dusted with cocoa powder. Tiramisu is elegant, indulgent, and perfect for entertaining.
ingredients: 3 tbsp Marsala wine or coffee liqueur
instructions: Brew strong espresso and let it cool completely. Mix with Marsala wine or liqueur in a shallow bowl.
Beat egg yolks and sugar together until pale and thick, about 5 minutes.
Add mascarpone to the egg yolk mixture and fold gently until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff peaks form.
Fold egg whites into the mascarpone mixture in two batches until just combined.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger in the espresso mixture for 1-2 seconds and layer in a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone cream over the ladyfinger layer.
Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and the remaining cream.
Dust generously with cocoa powder. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

about: A vibrant and energising matcha green tea smoothie blended with banana, milk, and honey. Packed with antioxidants and natural energy, this smoothie is both beautiful and delicious.
ingredients: 1 cup almond milk or regular milk
instructions: Add matcha powder to a small bowl with 2 tbsp of warm (not boiling) water and whisk until dissolved and smooth.
Place frozen banana, Greek yogurt, and milk into a blender.
Add the dissolved matcha, honey, and ice cubes.
Blend on high speed for 1-2 minutes until completely smooth and frothy.
Taste and adjust sweetness with more honey if needed.
Pour into a tall glass.
Dust lightly with extra matcha powder and serve immediately.

about: A luxurious twist on the classic mac and cheese elevated with earthy truffle oil and a blend of melted cheeses. Creamy, decadent, and utterly indulgent — this grown-up comfort food is next level.
instructions: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until just al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and whisk for 1-2 minutes to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in milk and heavy cream. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in Gruyere, cheddar, and Parmesan until fully melted.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg.
Stir in truffle oil and cooked pasta. Add pasta water if needed to loosen.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with breadcrumbs and extra Parmesan.
Bake at 200°C for 15-20 minutes until golden and bubbling. Serve hot.

about: A beloved Thai dessert featuring sweet glutinous sticky rice paired with fresh ripe mango and drizzled with rich, salted coconut cream. Simple, fragrant, and irresistibly good.
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Soak glutinous rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain well.
Steam the soaked rice over medium heat for 20-25 minutes until cooked through and translucent.
While rice steams, heat 300ml coconut milk with 3 tbsp sugar and 1/4 tsp salt over low heat until sugar dissolves. Do not boil.
Transfer cooked rice to a bowl and pour the warm coconut milk mixture over it. Stir and let it absorb for 20 minutes.
Make the topping sauce by heating remaining 100ml coconut milk with 1 tbsp sugar and 1/4 tsp salt. Add cornstarch mixture and stir until slightly thickened.
Peel and slice ripe mangoes.
Serve sticky rice on a plate alongside mango slices.
Drizzle the coconut cream topping over the rice and garnish with sesame seeds and mint leaves.
